alert.note: Alert for McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 6:35PM CDT until May 24 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern McCulloch County in west central Texas... San Saba County in west central Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 635 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hall, or near Placid, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Skeeterville around 650 PM CDT. Richland Springs around 655 PM CDT. Algerita around 700 PM CDT. San Saba around 715 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Harkeyville, Milburn, Locker, Spring Creek, Hall, Us- 190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line and Us- 190 Near The San Saba-Lampasas County Line. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
